DETALHAMENTO-DE-ORIENTACOES-CONCLUIDAS-P.NOME-DA-AGENCIA: Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Cientнfico e Tecnolуgico

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-2.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Mecвnica dos Corpos Sуlidos, Elбsticos e Plбsticos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Despite the fact that deep rolling is being performed in crankshafts for the past sixty years, there is no consolidated understanding on its residual stress generation process. Researches has treated the subject in a purely experimental way, without an attempt for a phenomenological explanation for the observations. Little information was found on the evolution throughout the processes inside the crankshaft manufacturing chain. The few authors that tried to model the deep rolling process through a numerical tool were still not able to consolidate a methodology for results assessment integrated to crankshaft fatigue performance. With that stated, the hypothesis of this research is that the residual stress distribution due to deep rolling parameters variation added to the operational loads perceptibly alters crankshaft fatigue performance. The objective, therefore, is the understanding and prediction of the influence of the deep rolling process on the endurance behavior of crankshafts. In order to accomplish that, the research followed an approach based on numerical modeling of the process together with the execution of fatigue experiments. That way, a comprehension based on the fundamental phenomenon can be addressed. Residual stresses were measured in order to validate the model and enable its use for a wide range of parameter alteration. The correlation between fatigue and numerical results is also imperative to push the knowledge boundaries on the topic. The developed model was satisfactorily validated through comparison with residual stress measurements. Models with diverse deep rolling parameters were generated and clear tendencies regarding residual stress profile shape and magnitude were outlined. Specimen batches with the same evaluated deep rolling parameters were produced for further residual stress measurements and fatigue experimentation. Their results? interconnection shed light over crankshaft crack nucleation and propagation. A correlation between nume

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Fabricaзгo de veнculos automotores, reboques e carrocerias

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The present work proposes the development of displacement-based finite element formulations to model composite laminates accounting for through-the-thickness and thermal effects. Two-dimensional formulations were developed based on the superposition of layerwise local displacement fields with global displacement fields for both in-plane and transverse displacements, enabling to recover stresses directly from constitutive relations. Non-homogeneous boundary conditions are accounted for in the formulations, while the number of degrees of freedom is kept independent of the number of layers. As a result, the elements attend a large variety of applications with a relatively low computational cost, while respecting composite physics. A general description of the proposed formulations, with its fundamental hypotheses and mathematical manipulations, is followed by the assessment of element capabilities. Results were compared with bi-dimensional analytical and highly refined commercial finite element solutions based on plane stress hypothesis. The numerical efficiency of the formulation is attested, as well as its advantages and limitations. An extension for three-dimensional finite elements is outlined and possible future developments for the research are proposed based on the results and conclusions
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The present work proposes the development of displacement-based finite element formulations to model composite laminates accounting for through-the-thickness and thermal effects. INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Esse trabalho tem como objetivo determinar os fatores de concentraзгo de tensгo de olhais, elementos estruturais para ligaзгo atravйs de pinos, com total transferкncia de carga.Para tanto foi desenvolvida uma ferramenta computacional, na linguagem de programaзгo Visual Basic, associada ao software CAE, MSC Visual Nastran for Windows 2003. O cбlculo desse fator й fundamental para uma anбlise de resistкncia а fadiga desse tipo de componente. Porйm, em virtude das caracterнsticas de geometria, carregamento e sua transferкncia, sгo necessбrias consideraзхes teуricas mais robustas para a modelagem via elementos finitos. Todas essas consideraзхes e a forma como foram implementadas nesta ferramenta sгo apresentadas ao longo do desenvolvimento do trabalho. Este aplicativo, integrado ao software MSC Visual Nastran for Windows 2003, terб grande utilidade para a empresa Embraer SA no prй-dimensionamento e anбlise estrutural estбtica, assim como а fadiga, de olhais.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Fabricaзгo e Montagem de Embarcaзхes, Veнculos Ferroviбrios e Aeronaves

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Ensaios de tiro em banco de provas horizontal de motores foguetes sгo essenciais para avaliaзгo e certificaзгo desses equipamentos. Nestes ensaios sгo medidos o empuxo, pressгo, temperatura e deformaзгo do motor foguete. Porйm, as calibraзхes dos instrumentos para retirar essas medidas sгo feitas considerando o banco de provas em situaзгo estбtica. Й sabido que, durante os ensaios de tiro em banco de motores foguete, ocorrem diversos fenфmenos, sendo um deles a vibraзгo devido а flutuaзгo do escoamento dos gases de escape atravйs da tubeira. Este fenфmeno induz um nнvel de vibraзгo no motor foguete que й transmitido ao banco, atravйs dos elementos de ligaзгo motor-banco de provas. Portanto, й muito importante o conhecimento do comportamento dinвmico do banco de provas horizontal para que os valores das medidas obtidas no ensaio sejam validadas. O objetivo deste trabalho й avaliar o comportamento do banco de provas horizontal, a fim de conhecer seus modos de vibraзгo e respectivas freqькncias naturais.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONC.TITULO: Sound simulation of the harp: focus on the finger-string interaction

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Produtos e Serviзos Recreativos, Culturais, Artнsticos e Desportivos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The harp is a string instrument constituted by several strings attached to a vibrating structure, producing an efficient sound propagation. The component of this structure directly connected to the strings, namely the soundboard, has a complex design and can be made from
different materials. The sound response of the harp depends on the values of the displacement and velocity of the excited string, at instant it is released to oscillate freely. Those initial conditions for the vibration movement results from the imposed excitation as well as on the physical interaction between the string and the finger of the player. For that reason, this scientific project intends to describe the physical properties of this interaction and to model the behaviour of the string, in order to output the fields of velocity and displacement of the string at the instant of imminent free oscillation movement. To achieve those goals, a theoretical description of the interaction phenomenon in addition to a method for fitting experimental data will be proposed. The resultant values of this project would be further used in the sound synthesis by a superposition model.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONC.TITULO: Anбlise da correlaзгo entre carga e tensгo numa fuselagem aeronбutica

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O trabalho consiste em uma ferramenta para anбlise da correlaзгo entre carga e tensгo numa fuselagem aeronбutica, possibilitando a obtenзгo de uma funзгo que estime o espectro de tensгo para anбlise de fadiga e tolerвncia a dano dentro de um modelo sugerido pela Embraer. A ferramenta utiliza mйtodos estatнsticos para computar a influкncia de cada esforзo estбtico aplicado а estrutura na determinaзгo da tensгo e extrapola o resultado para uma anбlise em onde os esforзos sгo dinвmicos, pois em fase inicial de projeto nгo hб dados suficientes para essa anбlise.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONC.TITULO: Desenvolvimento de um sistema eletroacъstico para reproduзгo da direcionalidade do campo sonoro de instrumentos musicais

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Ediзгo, Impressгo, Reproduзгo e Gravaзгo Industriais de Jornais, Revistas, Livros, Discos, Fitas, Vнdeos e Filmes

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
A distribuiзгo espacial da intensidade sonora emitida por uma fonte, ou direcionalidade do campo sonoro, tem vбrias aplicaзхes, tais como salas de cinema e cavernas de realidade virtual. Para obtк-la, pode-se dispor caixas de som ao redor do ambiente que se deseja sonorizar, ou alto-falantes em um espaзo limitado e alimentados por sinais independentes, de forma a tornar possнvel um controle sobre a direcionalidade do som emitido. Esta intensidade pode ser mensurada com uma rede de microfones dispostos numa semi-esfera centrada no instrumento em questгo. Neste estudo, uma fonte cъbica й ajustada de forma a reproduzir eletroacusticamente o som de qualquer instrumento musical, obtendo a mesma direcionalidade do instrumento original.
Partido da matriz de pressхes medida pela rede de microfones no experimento, pode-se aproximar uma emissгo da caixa que, situada na mesma posiзгo de gravaзгo do instrumento, traga resultados semelhantes. Uma vez conhecidas as pressхes, pode-se calcular qual й a entrada a ser dada para cada alto-falante. Para isso, deve-se conhecer a funзгo de transferкncia entre o sinal enviado a cada alto-falante e a matriz de pressхes. O cubo de alto-falantes й alimentado por seis entradas mono de бudio analуgicas, provenientes de um computador.
Num primeiro momento й realizada a gravaзгo dos instrumentos musicais na malha de microfones, gravando trechos curtos de melodias. Na seqькncia, o cubo й posicionado no lugar dos instrumentos e emite-se, saнda por saнda, um arquivo de som rico em freqькncias. Os dados obtidos sгo processados de forma a obter os seis sinais, um para cada alto-falante, que reproduzidos na fonte multi-canal resulta numa matriz de pressхes, que por fim й comparada com a original execuзгo da melodia.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este trabalho consiste no modelamento do problema e realizaзгo da anбlise modal do conjunto gerador de gбs da turbina desenvolvida pelo ITA, a fim de simular e visualizar concentraзхes de tensгo as quais a estrutura й submetida em operaзгo. DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONC.TITULO: Projeto fluido-dinвmico conceitual de um compressor supersфnico

DETALHAMENTO-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONCL.NOME-DA-AGENCIA: Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Cientнfico e Tecnolуgico

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Na бrea de pesquisa aeronбutica, os testes realizados em mбquinas possuem um custo bastante elevado. Na tentativa de se evitar um custo alto de projetos, nos utilizamos de meios que nos fornecem uma previsгo teуrica do comportamento do nosso objeto de estudo.
Para a realizaзгo do desenvolvimento conceitual de um compressor supersфnico, como em todos os projetos na бrea aeronбutica, devemos nos utilizar de mйtodos numйricos antes da tentativa de execuзгo de um protуtipo.
O objetivo desse trabalho й prever, atravйs de simulaзгo numйrica, as taxas de compressгo teуricas (dinвmica de fluidos computacional) obtidas em um compressor supersфnico. Para tal, utilizaremos o Fluent, um programa que realiza anбlises fluido dinвmicas.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONC.TITULO: Anбlise estrutural estбtica do kit BSU-49 com bombas BA-FG-230 e MK-82 na aeronave A-1

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The Brazilian Air Force (FAB) counts with a division which is responsible for studies, searches, projects and development of belic systems to be used in the aerospacial sector, attending the programs of interest of the Command of the Brazilian Air Force. This development of national belic systems to be used in FAB?s combat aircrafts is reducing more and more the dependence of Brazil in this kind of products from other countries. 
However, after the development of new belic system it is needed to make the integration process of the mentioned system with the FAB?s aircrafts. One first step in this process of integration consists on the static structural analysis, in which the real efforts that are been generated by the new armed configuration are estimated.
This work intends to proceed the static structural analysis of the Kit BSU 49 whit bombs MK-82 and BA-FG-230 in the aircraft A-1. This analysis was realized by comparison between the efforts generated by armed configurations already authorized, similar to the new ones, and the efforts generated by the armed configurations that are been proposed. It is important to emphasize that in the stations of the aircraft that the authorized and the proposed configurations diverge, it is needed that the authorized configurations to show a more critical situation using as criteria the mass of artifacts in each station.
This method is based in the application of the procedures described by the norms MIL-HDBK-1763 and MIL-A8591. These norms provide standards to analyze the compatibility between external stores and military aircrafts and establish the mechanic and structural criteria to the project of external stores to be used in aircrafts, respectively.

As anбlises deverгo ser feitas por meio de simulaзхes numйricas suportadas por cуdigos de elementos finitos disponнveis no mercado e aprovados pela FAA (Federal Aviation Administration) dos EUA.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONC.TITULO: Analysis of a new specimen's design for tensile testing in Split Hopkinson Pressure Bar using Abaqus
DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONC.TITULO-INGLES: Analysis of a new specimen's design for tensile testing in Split Hopkinson Pressure Bar using Abaqus

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Mecвnica dos Corpos Sуlidos, Elбsticos e Plбsticos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
As aplicaзхes de materiais sempre foram bem diversificadas desde formas rudimentares
аs mais complexas. Com o avanзo da tecnologia, tornou-se necessбria uma melhor compreensгo dos materiais empregados a fim de tornб-los aplicбveis ao propуsito desejado.
O conhecimento do comportamento dos materiais й fundamental para prever suas atitudes
perante novos experimentos e aplicaзхes. Desta forma, muitos esforзos tкm sido feitos
para inovaзгo e implementaзгo de tйcnicas que envolvem a aplicaзгo especнfica de materiais, desde sua conceitualizaзгo ? passando por sua concepзгo e devida qualificaзгo ? ao seu objetivo final (a aplicaзгo real em equipamentos que sгo indispensбveis no cotidiano).
O presente trabalho propхe uma forma diferente de testes de materiais. Com a utilizaзгo
do aparato Split Hopkinson Pressure Bar, buscou-se um novo formato para testes de traзгo,
o que nгo й possнvel para um aparato regular. Existem outras formas para realizar o teste
de traзгo em Split Hopkinson Pressure Bars, que sгo realizadas diretamente apenas mudando a configuraзгo e o posicionamento do projйtil a ser lanзado. Porйm, com esta mudanзa no desenho do espйcime, й possнvel que o teste seja realizado sem serem feitas tais modificaзхes.
Existem variadas restriзхes no modelo proposto e uma soluзгo de compromisso se faz
necessбria, na qual se deve balancear os prуs e contras de cada proposiзгo de restriзгo. O emprego do programa de elementos finitos Abaqus/CAE foi essencial para validaзгo do modelo, assim como o programa Matlab auxiliou nos cбlculos e grбficos para comparaзгo dos resultados.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Applications of materials have always been quite diverse from rudimentary to complex
forms. With the advancement of technology it has become a requirement the better understanding of the materials used to make them applicable to the desired purpose.
The knowledge of the behavior of materials is crucial to predict their responses towards
new experiments and applications. Thus, many efforts have been made for innovation and
implementation of techniques that involve the application of specific materials, from their conceptualization ? through their design and proper qualification ? to their final goal (the actual application in equipment that are essential to everyday life).
This paper proposes a different way of testing materials. With the use of the Split Hopkinson
Pressure Bar apparatus, we sought a new format for tensile testing, which is not possible
for a regular apparatus. There are other ways to make tensile testings in Split Hopkinson Pressure Bars, by changing the configuration and placement of the projectile being launched. But with the proposed change in the design of the specimen, it is possible to perform the test without such changes.
There are various constraints in the proposed model. Hence, there must be a compromise
solution that balances pros and cons of each constraint. The use of finite element program
Abaqus/CAE was essential to validate the model. The Matlab program was useful in calculations and charts to compare the results.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONC.TITULO: Mйtodos computacionais para a soluзгo de problemas de autovalor complexo

DETALHAMENTO-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONCL.NOME-DA-AGENCIA: Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Cientнfico e Tecnolуgico

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O projeto visou a implementaзгo do algoritmo QZ, na linguagem C, para a resoluзгo do problema do autovalor complexo. A motivaзгo desse problema veio de uma necessidade do campo da aeroelasticidade que estuda um fenфmeno da deformaзгo chamado flutter (que fatalmente recai nesse problema do autovalor). Para isso foi feita uma revisгo da linguagem C e de seus subtуpicos (como a alocaзгo dinвmica de memуria), a compreensгo do artigo (sobre o algoritmo) escrito por Stewart e Moler, a implementaзгo de algoritmos de apoio a resoluзгo do problema (como as reduзхes de householder, rotaзхes de Givens, algoritmo QR e inversгo de matrizes). Apesar do algoritmo QZ nгo ter sido completamente configurado, a maioria das suas subrotinas foram confeccionadas e implementadas com sucesso (inclusive o algoritmo QR). Isso possibilitou um grande avanзo nesse sentido jб que todas as tentativas anteriores de implementaзгo desse algoritmo foram frustradas no sentido de se criar algoritmos de fбcil entendimento.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONC.TITULO: Estudo das deformaзхes de uma chapa metбlica devido ao processo de estampagem utilizando simulaзгo computacional

DETALHAMENTO-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONCL.NOME-DA-AGENCIA: Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Cientнfico e Tecnolуgico

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
O objetivo do trabalho foi compreender os conceitos fнsicos por trбs do fenфmeno da deformaзгo plбstica do metal, o que inclui suas classificaзхes, mecanismos responsбveis e mйtodos de inspeзгo, utilizando simulaзгo computacional acerca do processo de estampagem de chapas metбlicas, determinando assim os parвmetros geomйtricos que fornecem o melhor resultado quanto а minimizaзгo de tais deformaзхes. 
A metodologia empregada consistiu na realizaзгo de diversas simulaзхes de estampagem, variando os parвmetros geomйtricos envolvidos, que sгo os raios, altura dos beads e espessura das chapas, assim possibilitando a compreensгo das deformaзхes sofridas pela chapa e a minimizaзгo de tais deformaзхes.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONC.TITULO: Anбlise de defeitos em chapas metбlicas apуs processo de soldagem

DETALHAMENTO-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONCL.NOME-DA-AGENCIA: Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Cientнfico e Tecnolуgico

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
O objetivo desse trabalho foi definir a influencia dos parвmetros dos processos de solda a ponto sobre as distorзхes sofridas por chapas soldadas. Tendo isso em vista, o escopo aborda tambйm a forma como sua inspeзгo e identificaзгo podem ser avaliadas objetivamente como melhoria no potencial da precisгo da correlaзгo entre defeitos de mediзгo e anбlise numйrica focando na sua prediзгo. Por fim, o projeto teve como metas a busca de causas e soluзхes para o problema em pauta.
A metodologia a ser empregada consistiu em sucessivas simulaзхes do processo de soldagem em chapas, analisando a influкncia de diversos fatores na eficiкncia da soldagem, tais quais a presenзa ou nгo de clamps, ordem dos pontos de soldagem, entre outros.. Para isso fazer a simulaзгo do processo de soldagem de tais peзas foi usado o software WeldPlanner.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONC.TITULO: Revisгo de mуdulos analнticos de forзas para usinagem
DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONC.TITULO-INGLES: A review of analytically obtained forces in machining processes

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: No вmbito da usinagem de peзas, saber os parвmetros e seus valores de controle para se ter o resultado desejado й um interesse primordial para os engenheiros responsбveis. Para isso, deve-se realizar testes preliminares para caracterizar o processo e, com isso, estimar os parвmetros a serem controlados. Contudo, esses testes demandam tempo e tem custo pecuniбrio, o que й desvantajoso para a indъstria. Algumas das variбveis de saнda que sгo desejбveis de se controlar sгo as forзas de usinagem - elas influenciam nas tensхes residuais na peзa acabada, na vida da ferramenta, no desgaste da mбquina etc. Por esse motivo, o presente trabalho buscou estudar mуdulos analнticos, teуricos, para descrever e simular as forзas de usinagem numericamente sem que fossem necessбrios, a priori, testes preliminares: nesse caso sу seriam necessбrios testes subsidiбrios para ratificar os resultados. Como constatado, entretanto, modelos teуricos estгo sujeitos a hipуteses simplificadoras e podem nгo ser aplicбveis a todos os casos reais. No modelo analнtico obtido neste trabalho, hб um erro na forзa simulada com relaзгo а forзa medida experimentalmente e, por isso, nгo se pode validar o mуdulo simplesmente pelo experimento. Alйm disso, pode ser observado que, para a obtenзгo dos parвmetros necessбrios para a simulaзгo teуrica, й necessбria a caracterizaзгo do material para resultados confiбveis.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Within the machining of parts, know the parameters and their control values to have the desired results is a paramount concern for the responsible engineers. For this, preliminary tests should be performed to characterize the process and thereby estimate the parameters to be controlled. However, these tests are time consuming and have monetary cost, which is disadvantageous in industry. Some of the output variables that are desirable to control is the machining forces - they influence the residual stresses in the finished part, the tool life, the machine wear, etc. For this reason, the present work studied analytical, theoretical modules to describe and simulate the machining forces numerically without being necessary a priori preliminary tests: in this case it would only be necessary ancillary tests to confirm the results. As noted, however, theoretical models are subject to simplifying assumptions and may not apply to all actual cases. In the analytical model obtained in this work, there is an error in the simulated force with respect to force measured experimentally and, therefore, the module cannot be validated just based on the experiment. Furthermore, it can be observed that to obtain the necessary parameters for the theoretical simulation, the characterization of the material is necessary to obtain reliable results.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONC.TITULO: Estudo da confiabilidade de juntas soldadas de chapas para aplicaзгo automotiva
DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONC.TITULO-INGLES: reliability study of welded joints in thin sheets for automotive application

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Fabricaзгo de veнculos automotores, reboques e carrocerias
SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Fabricaзгo de produtos de metal, exceto mбquinas e equipamentos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Este trabalho apresenta um estudo tйcnico quantitativo sobre as juntas soldadas. A partir dos dados coletados em ensaios mecвnicos destrutivos de traзгo-cisalhamento em amostras soldadas sob diferentes condiзхes de soldagem, foram aplicados os conceitos de probabilidade, anбlise de Weinbull e confiabilidade para obter curvas de confiabilidade e estimar como se comportam tais junзхes.
A anбlise desses dados possibilitou inferir conclusхes sobre o comportamento das curvas de confiabilidade ao se variar parвmetros de soldagem. Isso permite que a indъstria automotiva tenha mais ferramentas que possibilitem se obter juntas soldadas mais eficientes e confiбveis, ou seja, com menor gasto e de qualidade desejada.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
This work presents a quantitative technical study on welded joints. From the data collected in destructive tensile-shear mechanical tests for samples welded with various welding conditions, the concepts of probability, Weinbull analysis and reliability were applied to obtain reliability curves and to estimate how such joints behave.
The analysis of these data allowed one to draw conclusions about the behavior of reliability curves by varying a number of welding parameters. This provides the automotive industry with one more tool to design more efficient and reliable welded joints, with lower costs and better quality.

DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONC.TITULO: Anбlise de lementos finitos aplicada ao estudo de flambagem tйrmica de paineis
DADOS-BASICOS-DE-OUTRAS-ORIENTACOES-CONC.TITULO-INGLES: Numerical simulation applied to the study of thermal buckling

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Fabricaзгo de veнculos automotores, reboques e carrocerias

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este trabalho aborda um caso especial de flambagem onde o carregamento da estrutura й tйrmico e as tensхes sгo consequкncia de alguma restriзгo а livre expansгo do material. Tal fenфmeno й conhecido como flambagem tйrmica. Dada a alta complexidade e dificuldade de aplicaзгo de mйtodos analнticos para a anбlise deste fenфmeno no contexto de um projeto, o mйtodo numйrico de elementos finitos se torna de grande valia. O objetivo deste trabalho й estudar a aplicaзгo do mйtodo em elementos finitos com o software comercial ANSYS na anбlise do fenфmeno da flambagem tйrmica em painйis finos, tanto planos quanto com diferentes curvaturas, avaliando a influкncia de diferentes parвmetros geomйtricos, alйm condiзхes de contorno no modo e a temperatura crнtica de flambagem. Sгo realizadas primariamente anбlises lineares para anбlises paramйtricas com simulaзхes nгo lineares para validaзхes de resultados e comparaзхes. Espera-se que com a compreensгo dos mecanismos de flambagem em tais estruturas e da influкncia de parвmetros como curvatura, pontos de fixaзгo e condiзхes de contorno o projetista esteja mais bem preparado para contornar desafios relacionados а fabricaзгo ou operaзгo do produto.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This study concerns a special case of buckling where the loading of the structure is thermal, and the stresses are consequence of some restriction to the free expansion of the material. This phenomenon is known as thermal buckling. Given the high complexity and difficulty of applying analytical methods in the analysis of this phenomenon in the context of a project, the numerical method of finite elements becomes of high value. The objective of this work is to study the application of the finite element method with ANSYS, a commercial software, in the analysis of the phenomenon of thermal buckling in thin panels, both flat and with different curvatures, evaluating the influence of different geometric parameters, besides boundaries conditions in the buckling mode and the critical temperature. Linear analysis is used primarily for parametric analysis and nonlinear simulations for validation of results and comparisons. It is expected that with the understanding of the buckling mechanisms in such structures and the influence of parameters such as curvature, fixation points and boundary conditions the designer is better prepared to overcome challenges related to the fabrication or operation of the product.

O intuito й predizer danos causados por impacto de baixa energia em uma estrutura nervurada aeronбutica construнda em compуsito laminado de carbono de modo a facilitar o projeto de ensaios para certificaзгo. Crankshaft deep rolling modeling through explicit analysis using finite element method

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Fabricaзгo de veнculos automotores, reboques e carrocerias

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The development of a new crankshaft design needs a long phase of testing for the determination of the component?s fatigue limit. This is partially due to lack of information on the residual stress field induced by the manufacturing processes. The selection of parameters to be used in the crankshaft manufacture, especially the deep rolling process, is made with the assistance of workbench experiments. The rolling stage is the main responsible for elevating the fatigue limit, since it introduces compressive residual stresses in critical regions. For this reason it is subject of extensive research in the present time. However, these studies are limited to the comparison of results obtained through fatigue bench tests with different rolling parameters. A numerical model can be a viable alternative and can result in reduction of both number and cost of experiments. These models are currently under development and there are no consolidated and validated methods to be applied. Therefore, this work has the objective of proposing a numeric model for this manufacturing process using the finite element method. The development of the model passed through the choice of solution type to be applied, whether implicit or explicit. The mechanical properties of the crankshaft material were determined by tests in a tension/compression machine. Application of boundary conditions had as input the rolling load cycle. As the results of interest are relative to a specific region, the choice for element type and mesh structure are crucial to the accuracy of the output. Stress and strain fields were obtained from the simulations. As a first step for model validation, geometry measurements of the region of interest were compared with the analysis results. Future studies can include residual stress measurement and comparison with the outputs already found in the simulations.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Mecвnica dos Corpos Sуlidos, Elбsticos e Plбsticos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A new C1 element is proposed to model Euler-Bernoulli beams for one and two-dimensional problems. The formulated element has only degrees of freedom related to translation (axial and transverse displacements). This represents an economy compared to the traditional element that uses degrees of freedom related to the rotation induced by bending in order to assure continuity of transverse displacement derivative. The element proposed naturally satisfies the first derivative continuity requirement through the use of an Overhauser interpolation scheme. An overview of Overhauser interpolation is presented. The kinematics of a generic beam according to the Euler-Bernoulli theory is specified. The principle of virtual displacements is used to determine the equilibrium equations and boundary conditions for one and two-dimensional problems. The Overhauser bending interpolation functions are defined using only the degrees of freedom related to the transverse displacements. For the axial displacements the same interpolation functions of traditional elements are used. Finally, beam and plane frame problems are solved with the new formulation and the results are compared to the exact and traditional Euler-Bernoulli element solutions.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: A new C1 element is proposed to model Euler-Bernoulli beams for one and two-dimensional problems. The formulated element has only degrees of freedom related to translation (axial and transverse displacements). This represents an economy compared to the traditional element that uses degrees of freedom related to the rotation induced by bending in order to assure continuity of transverse displacement derivative. The element proposed naturally satisfies the first derivative continuity requirement through the use of an Overhauser interpolation scheme. An overview of Overhauser interpolation is presented. The kinematics of a generic beam according to the Euler-Bernoulli theory is specified. The principle of virtual displacements is used to determine the equilibrium equations and boundary conditions for one and two-dimensional problems. The Overhauser bending interpolation functions are defined using only the degrees of freedom related to the transverse displacements. For the axial displacements the same interpolation functions of traditional elements are used. Finally, beam and plane frame problems are solved with the new formulation and the results are compared to the exact and traditional Euler-Bernoulli element solutions.

AREA-DO-CONHECIMENTO-1.NOME-DA-ESPECIALIDADE: Mecвnica dos Corpos Sуlidos, Elбsticos e Plбsticos

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Surface integrity can be considered as a parameter that is most studied by its effects in the product performance. In this way, the relationship between the functionality and manufacturing variable effects has been mapped, mainly associated with machining process. This process is focused due to the connection among the thermo-mechanical loads generated during the process and the residual stress induced by them. For that reason, industries that have dynamic component production with the machining process as the base of the manufacturing chain will be a potential in that combination. The gear industry presents as a potential in its aspects. In combination with that perspective, sustainable practices have been applied in that segment, such that for the costs reduction, loss reduction and environmental adjustments, parameter optimization of the process is demanded. Therefore, validation of functional integrity is more required. As experimental processes are time consumption, alternative methods as computational are searched, existing just inefficient approaches for complex machining operations. Thus, a lack for a research to find new numerical approaches to that purpose is evidenced. A possible way, by finite element method, is the hybrid approach for complex machining processes. This line of attack can be describe as the direct application of the machining loads in the workpiece without the necessity to modelling the interaction between tool and workpiece. However, that method was just tested for simple cases of machining, and the application for a more complex process is not visualized yet. Thereby, for that work, a proposal for apply the hybrid method in the end-milling process was made, preceding its application of gear hobbing. With that approach, was observed the substantial reduction of time for solving the model (from days to hours) with the desired outcomes (residual stress field). The challenges associated with this method were confirmed as load measurements a

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este projeto de doutorado objetiva investigar os efeitos do processo de soldagem a ponto por resistкncia (RSW) na integridade de juntas soldadas de aзo de Plasticidade Induzida por Maclaзгo (TWIP), bem como tambйm investigar as alteraзхes na integridade das juntas quando uma cadeia de manufatura й considerada. Primeiramente, foi realizado um estudo de parametrizaзгo do processo de RSW. Para isso, foram produzidas juntas soldadas variando-se os principais parвmetros envolvidos no processo: corrente, tempo e forзa de compressгo de eletrodos. Investigaзхes experimentais foram realizadas para estudar de que modo as variaзхes nos parвmetros do processo de RSW influenciam nas caracterнsticas mecвnicas e metalъrgicas das juntas soldadas. Posteriormente, foram realizadas investigaзхes para estudar a distribuiзгo de tensхes residuais nas juntas soldadas e como as mesmas sгo afetadas pelas variaзхes nos diferentes parвmetros do processo de RSW. Da mesma forma como observado para a microestrutura e propriedades mecвnicas, as anбlises de DRX mostraram que as distribuiзхes de tensхes residuais sгo sensнveis аs variaзхes de cada um dos principais parвmetros de soldagem. Os resultados experimentais tambйm evidenciaram correlaзхes positivas entre as variaзхes nos parвmetros de soldagem com mudanзas de microestrutura, distribuiзгo de tensхes residuais e confiabilidade mecвnica das juntas soldadas. Compreendidos os efeitos dos diferentes parвmetros de RSW na integridade das juntas soldadas, foram conduzidos experimentos com o intuito de investigar o quanto a integridade das juntas soldadas й sensнvel a duas diferentes cadeias de manufatura: a primeira considerando uma etapa de deformaзгo plбstica prйvia а soldagem, enquanto que a segunda rota envolve o processo de RSW seguido de um ciclo tйrmico. Uma abordagem convergente foi concebida de modo a isolar os efeitos das diferentes etapas de manufatura. Os resultados evidenciaram que a integridade como um todo de juntas soldadas de aзos
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This doctorate research project aims to investigate the effect of the resistance spot welding (RSW) process on the integrity of Twinning-Induced Plasticity (TWIP) steel weld spots and also to investigate the changes in the joint integrity when a manufacturing chain is considered. Firstly, a RSW parametrization study was performed. Weld spots were produced by varying the three main RSW parameters: welding current, welding time and electrode compression force. Experimental investigations were conducted to study the influence of these parameters on the mechanical and metallurgical characteristics of the weld spots. Subsequently, x-ray diffraction (XRD) analysis were carried out to investigate the distribution of residual stresses along the weld spots and how they are affected by the variations in the welding parameters. Similar to the observed for the microstructure and mechanical properties, the XRD data suggested that the magnitude and gradient of residual stresses are sensible to the variations in each of the main RSW parameters. The experimental findings also evidenced that there are positive correlations between the variations in the RSW parameters, the material features, the distribution of residual stresses and the mechanical reliability of the weld spots. Lastly, investigations on the evolution of the residual stresses along two different manufacturing routes were carried out. The first route encompassed a plastic deformation prior to the welding stage, whereas the second involved the spot welding followed by a bake treatment. A convergent approach was adopted to isolate the effects of the first and final manufacturing steps. The findings evidenced that the integrity of TWIP steel weld spots in the as-welded condition does not reflect the real integrity of the component, as other individual manufacturing steps may promote material changes, which came accompanied by changes in the residual stresses state. SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-2: Fabricaзгo de veнculos automotores, reboques e carrocerias

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
Shape distortions and warpage are a major source of problems for composite manufacturers. These distortions are usual-ly accompanied by built up residual stresses. They can deform a component so that it becomes useless. It also has the capability to reduce the strength of the structure. In this paper, the three-dimensional version of the constitutive model originally proposed by Svanberg and Holmberg is employed to predict the warpage of a wing planform. The model takes into account important mecha-nisms such as thermal expansion, resin shrinkage and frozen-in strains developed during curing cycles. The model was implemented into ABAQUS Finite Element code as a user subroutine UMAT. The macromechanical properties of each composite layer were pre-dicted using a micromechanics based approach, implemented into MATLAB. Results show that wings with cross ply laminates with reducing thickness along the span experienced more warpage than quasi-isotropic laminates. Furthermore, for wings with equal thick-ness along the span, the results show that the quasi-isotropic lam-inates experienced more warpage than cross
ply laminates. Lastly, the results show that wings with progressively reducing thickness experience twist that is varying from the wing root to the wing tip while wings with a constant thickness experience twist mainly at the centre of the wing.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES:
Shape distortions and warpage are a major source of problems for composite manufacturers. These distortions are usual-ly accompanied by built up residual stresses. They can deform a component so that it becomes useless. It also has the capability to reduce the strength of the structure. In this paper, the three-dimensional version of the constitutive model originally proposed by Svanberg and Holmberg is employed to predict the warpage of a wing planform. The model takes into account important mecha-nisms such as thermal expansion, resin shrinkage and frozen-in strains developed during curing cycles. The model was implemented into ABAQUS Finite Element code as a user subroutine UMAT. The macromechanical properties of each composite layer were pre-dicted using a micromechanics based approach, implemented into MATLAB. Results show that wings with cross ply laminates with reducing thickness along the span experienced more warpage than quasi-isotropic laminates. Furthermore, for wings with equal thick-ness along the span, the results show that the quasi-isotropic lam-inates experienced more warpage than cross
ply laminates. Lastly, the results show that wings with progressively reducing thickness experience twist that is varying from the wing root to the wing tip while wings with a constant thickness experience twist mainly at the centre of the wing.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Esse trabalho apresenta uma avaliaзгo numйrica e experimental das caracterнsticas dinвmicas de materiais compуsitos laminados com rigidez variбvel, principalmente sobre o efeito do tow steering no amortecimento modal para diferentes trajetуrias de fibras. O modelo dinвmico й derivado usando uma abordagem semi-analнtica baseada na combinaзгo da Teoria Clбssica do Laminados (CLT) com a abordagem Rayleigh-Ritz (assumed modes). Os fatores de amortecimento modais sгo calculados usando o mйtodo de energia de deformaзгo, que й baseado na razгo entre as energias armazenadas e dissipadas, fornecendo a capacidade de amortecimento especнfica (SDC) para cada modo de vibraзгo. Os resultados mostram que, para as placas com rigidez variбvel, a capacidade especнfica de amortecimento pode ser alterada bem como todo o comportamento dinвmico, em comparaзгo com os laminados com fibras retas tradicionais. Esses resultados indicam que a tйcnica de tow steering pode ser uma estratйgia eficaz para melhorar os nнveis de amortecimento e otimizaзгo das respostas dinвmicas em compуsitos.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The present work proposes the development of finite elements to model composite structures accounting for thickness and thermal effects, satisfying the C0z requirements, in response to recent demands of the scientific community. Developments use an axiomatic type approach with a displacement-based formulation with the global-local superposition hypothesis. A beam element was developed with through the thickness behavior described by the superposition of a layerwise linear local field with a cubic global field for both in-plane and transverse displacements. Stresses were recovered directly from constitutive relations, not requiring any post-processing technique. Non-homogeneous boundary conditions are accounted in the formulation. First, a literature review presents the fundamentals for the development path. Then, a general description of the proposed element is followed by the assessment of its capabilities. Results were compared with bi-dimensional (2-D) analytical and commercial finite element solutions based on plane stress hypothesis. Finally, possible future developments for the research are proposed based on the results discussions.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The present work proposes the development of finite elements to model composite structures accounting for thickness and thermal effects, satisfying the C0z requirements, in response to recent demands of the scientific community. Developments use an axiomatic type approach with a displacement-based formulation with the global-local superposition hypothesis. A beam element was developed with through the thickness behavior described by the superposition of a layerwise linear local field with a cubic global field for both in-plane and transverse displacements. Stresses were recovered directly from constitutive relations, not requiring any post-processing technique. Non-homogeneous boundary conditions are accounted in the formulation. First, a literature review presents the fundamentals for the development path. Then, a general description of the proposed element is followed by the assessment of its capabilities. Results were compared with bi-dimensional (2-D) analytical and commercial finite element solutions based on plane stress hypothesis. Finally, possible future developments for the research are proposed based on the results discussions.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Manufactured components are submitted to thermo-mechanical loads that can blemish their surface integrity and change the inherent residual stress distribution. The discontinuous machining process is relevant to the integrity conception because of their potential application at the end of the manufacturing chain. In order to consolidate a method to predict the residual stress state with a reduced CPU effort, this paper addresses the prediction of residual stress fields resulting from the milling process. The approach is using the hybrid FEM approach combined with the analysis of the plastic flow. The results obtained point out to the validity of the combination of the hybrid method and the visualization of the equivalent stress and equivalent strain rates. Moreover, a direct correspondence between the references and experimental dataset was observed, even when the input data for the model is associated with macro-loads obtained by piezoelectric platform measurements. The determination of the stress state as residual stress in mainly associated to the mesh convergence and the time to equilibrate the plastic flow. A conclusion is drawn regarding the viability of applying the same combination for other manufacturing processes.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Manufactured components are submitted to thermo-mechanical loads that can blemish their surface integrity and change the inherent residual stress distribution. INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The use of composite materials is rapidly increasing in many fields of engineering, mainly due to their high specific stiffness and strength, coupled with enhanced fatigue and corrosion resistance. Despite the numerous advantages, many challenges exist regarding the use of composite materials. One of the unique characteristics of composites is the degree of attention required in the material procurement specification and manufacturing, since material properties are highly dependent on final part quality. The layerwise construction nature of composites make them particularly prone to manufacturing induced defects, such as foreign object inclusions, porosity and ply wrinkling. For this reason, Nondestructive Inspection (NDI) techniques play an important role in composite quality assurance, as they provide means to assess structural integrity without causing damage to the component under analysis. Among the different NDI techniques, active Infrared Thermography (IRT) has received considerable attention by the composite community in the last years, due to its non-contact nature, high inspection rate and easy data interpretation. The present research explores the use of optical long pulse IRT as an in-process NDI technique, for early detection of manufacturing defects during manual layup of carbon-epoxy prepreg fabrics.

Nenhuma informaзгo foi encontrada a respeito da interaзгo entre os processos dentro da cadeia de manufatura de virabrequins. Os poucos autores que tentaram modelar o processo de roleteamento profundo atravйs de ferramentas numйricas ainda nгo conseguiram consolidar uma metodologia de anбlise dos resultados integrada ao desempenho do componente em fadiga. Com isso estabelecido, a hipуtese desse estudo й que a distribuiзгo de tensгo residual causada pela variaзгo dos parвmetros do processo de roleteamento, adicionada аs cargas operacionais, podem perceptivelmente alterar o desempenho em fadiga da peзa. O objetivo, portanto, й o entendimento e a prediзгo da influкncia do processo de roleteamento sobre a resistкncia a fadiga do virabrequim. INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Despite the fact that deep rolling is being performed in crankshafts for the past sixty years, there is no consolidated understanding on its residual stress generation process. Researches has treated the subject in a purely experimental way, without an attempt for a phenomenological explanation for the observations. No information was found on the interaction between processes inside the crankshaft manufacturing chain. The few authors that tried to model the deep rolling process through a numerical tool were still not able to consolidate a methodology for results assessment integrated to crankshaft fatigue performance. With that stated, the hypothesis of this research is that the residual stress distribution due to deep rolling parameters variation added to the operational loads perceptibly alters crankshaft fatigue performance. The objective, therefore, is the understanding and prediction of the influence of the deep rolling process on the endurance behavior of crankshafts. In order to accomplish that, the research followed an approach based on numerical modeling of the process together with the execution of fatigue experiments. That way, a comprehension based on the fundamental phenomenon can be addressed. Residual stresses were measured in order to validate the model and enable its use for a wide range of parameter alteration. The correlation between fatigue and numerical results is also imperative to push the knowledge boundaries on the topic. Up to the moment of this qualifying exam, the model could be satisfactorily validated through comparison with residual stress measurements. Models with a variety of different deep rolling parameters were already simulated with interesting tendencies regarding residual stress profile shape and magnitude. A first batch of fatigue experiments was already conducted, giving important information on crankshaft crack nucleation and propagation. An initial correlation between numerical model and fatigue results could be drawn. The

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Para expandir o estado-da-arte de forma quantitativa, o objetivo dessa dissertaзгo й desenvolver um modelo preditivo para tensхes residuais (TR) em engrenagens induzida pela interaзгo entre processos de fabricaзгo. Esse desenvolvimento orientado da cadeia de manufatura em busca de um estado especнfico de TR conceitua o Design for Residual Stress (DRS). Esse mйtodo de design busca um estado уtimo de tensхes residuais, considerando um modo de falha especнfico para ser evitado e indesejadas saнdas de processos de manufatura anteriores. O escopo de projeto a ser desenvolvido pelo bolsista TT-3 contempla o suporte а formalizaзгo e validaзгo do mйtodo para predizer a interaзгo de processos, meio da interaзгo do jateamento de granalhas e retнfica. Para quantificaзгo do efeito de interaзгo entre processos nas TR, o processo de retнfica serб modelado por meio do mйtodo hнbrido em elementos finitos, que substitui o contato peзa-ferramenta pelos carregamentos (mecвnico e tйrmico) gerados durante a usinagem. A validaзгo, a ser executada pela comparaзгo com resultados experimentais obtidos por difraзгo de raios-X e a expansгo do Unstable Area of Residual Stress (UARS) de forma preditiva serгo desta forma suportados pelo bolsista para a consolidaзгo do mйtodo ao fim da execuзгo do auxнlio regular.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The purpose of this dissertation is to conduct a dynamic elasto-plastic finite element analysis of the shot peening process taking into account an initial residual stress state generated by a previous process. An analytical forging model is developed to represent the process that took place prior to shot peening, observing the interaction between residual stress profiles and its impact in the numerical model, regarding the energy stabilization, mesh quality and residual stress prediction. This model will be validated by comparing the residual stress development from the experiment with the numerical model using DRX measurements. It is expected to create a procedure where a shot peening model can interact in a chain of processes. It is also the purpose of this paper to observe the influence of an initial residual stress profile on the resulting residual stress from shot peening. Overall, this work improves on the knowledge of the effect of residual stress interaction into the energy stability of the model, mesh quality and convergence.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A classical laminate theory based constitutive model for describing thermoplastic composites? mechanical properties and residual stresses development during consolidation is proposed. The extended Hillier model is applied to describe the material?s crystallization and as such is able to provide final part quality as a function of the process cooling history while taking into account the first and second crystallization mechanisms occurring concurrently. With the developed model, a parametric study was performed with general design guidelines suggesting desirable layup sequences for the laminate. Some of the advantages in using X-ply and quasi-isotropic laminates became clear as no shear residual stresses were predicted for those laminates. Numerical simulations indicate that the chemical residual strains can be, although smaller than thermal residual strains, relevant to final part quality. The combination of both effects may result in high residual stresses at ply level which in turn can compromise the ultimate strength of the laminates.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: A classical laminate theory based constitutive model for describing thermoplastic composites? mechanical properties and residual stresses development during consolidation is proposed. INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Surface integrity can be considered as a parameter that is most studied by its effects in the product performance. In this way, the relationship between the functionality and manufacturing variable effects has been mapped, mainly associated with machining process. This process is focused due to the connection among the thermo-mechanical loads generated during the process and the residual stress induced by them. For that reason, industries that have dynamic component production with the machining process as the base of the manufacturing chain will be a potential in that combination. The gear industry presents as a potential in its aspects. In combination with that perspective, sustainable practices have been applied in that segment, such that for the costs reduction, loss reduction and environmental adjustments, parameter optimization of the process is demanded. Therefore, validation of functional integrity is more required. As experimental processes are time consumption, alternative methods as computational are searched, existing just inefficient approaches for complex machining operations. Thus, a lack for a research to find new numerical approaches to that purpose is evidenced. A possible way, by finite element method, is the hybrid approach for complex machining processes. This line of attack can be describe as the direct application of the machining loads in the workpiece without the necessity to modelling the interaction between tool and workpiece. However, that method was just tested for simple cases of machining, and the application for a more complex process is not visualized yet. Thereby, for that work, a proposal for apply the hybrid method in the end-milling process was made, preceding its application of gear hobbing. With that approach, was observed the substantial reduction of time for solving the model (from days to hours) with the desired outcomes (residual stress field). The challenges associated with this method were confirmed as load measurements a
